comments.comment:
Well said..! As a Sri Lankan living in Canada I am sad and disgusted that our country has never learnt the lessons from the past. For 30 years we fought a bitter civil war killing many innocent people on both sides. For what..?  Are people in our country such idiots that they cannot learn from the past.?  Why do we keep electing such morons who use these incidents to maximize their political gains?  It boggles my mind why people support these leaders who are incapable of protecting its citizens and maintain the law and order.

Then again after reading some of the dumb comments below, I can understand why our country is in such a pathetic state..!  They cannot even appreciate a genuine and sensible message coming from a true patriotic son of mother Lanka, like Kumar Sangakkara.  

Please keep up the good work Mr. Sangakkara.  We appreciate you and thank you for speaking the truth.

comments.comment: Kumar, you are preaching to the choir here. I admire and value your effort and time to speak on behalf of our country. How ever, look no further than the comments below. I know you are a true gentleman. Keep it up Kumar  !!! Praying for my city Kandy and my country, across the miles from  the other side of the world.

replies.replyComment:
Ayesha Perera Such a nice decent woman you are. See the style of your language. I respect you wonderful sinhalese lady !!. BTW, I am a muslim. I do not think that 'Mohemad Fasil' is truly a muslim person. The naming style itself proves it. It is a fabricated Muslim name by someone else - probably by a Racist. It should be 'Mohamed Fazil'.

My Dear Sinhala Brothers, I believe you are all angry due to some misconceptions. Come let us sit and talk as brothers. Let us bring a good future for both of us. Fighting hurts everyone. I hope you will not blame me also with filthy words. It is a humble request from a brother who respects Buddhism & Buddhists.

Let us love each other...

mohammed fasil ube ammata hukala thaththage gu kapan ponnaya. ammage gu kapan savanata dagena allahge ganige kibma rathuda parayo thopi dagalannna epa api balagena inne sadda wahala inne. aurudu kittu karala warella nuwara town ekata harida. thopi mona ponnayida hukanno apita. paiya galawala athata denne. thope kello hathara denek ekka bidiya huththek pako mam. siyata siyak sinhala. ona ekak one deyak nuwara town eke. ewagema anitj town walath ehemai raganna lasthi wenna epa ammala thaththalata wandi gewanna wenne pako harida.ubawa hoyala shot eka dena eka loku deyak nemei pako. danno danithi api gana. ube ammawa marala hangala walalala atakau tika godata aran thota suppu karanna denawa pakayo sup hadanne kariya thoge ammage mas walin dagalanna epa kariyo le rath wela tiyenne kariyo dagalanna epa. policeyata gahapu mata tho mona kibi wesige puthekda pakayo. ammage gu kapan thaththage hujja bila kari wesa hukana ponnaya. thoge allah wa mata pennapan nabiyawai okkotama kalin. urek dala nabiyata puke arawanne kari wesige hukana ponna wesa ballige walaththa awajathaka paiyak nathi mas kaka inna gothrika kari ponnaya. hukawaganna epa pakaya danaganin.
Samarasingha 1234  obe ammata Hukala giyot bella kapanne nethuva hire dala 10 idala nidahas wela avit aye pavlata Hukala 10 asada
Terrance Priyankara allahge ammata hukala nabiyata katata demu. muslim poojakawaru maramu.
mun wena ratakata yay apita yanna wenne walata

Wasantha Disanayaka -. There is a sinhala video too. You can find it on here. But why is it important that the message should be in sinhala? I'm a sinhalese married to a tamil. Don't think we take anything when we leave this world.  It's only love understanding respect for each other and our values are what we leave behind for the next generation. Hope every Srilankan understand this.
